response.content:
{
  "step1": "Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour two 9‑inch round cake pans, then set aside. In a large bowl, whisk together 2 ½ cups all‑purpose flour, 2 ½ teaspoons baking powder, ½ teaspoon baking soda, and ½ teaspoon salt. This dry mix ensures even leavening.",
  "step2": "In a separate bowl, combine 1 ¾ cups granulated sugar, ¾ cup unsweetened cocoa powder, and 1 ½ cups melted butter. Beat in 4 large eggs, one at a time, until the mixture is smooth and glossy. Add 2 teaspoons vanilla extract for aromatic depth.",
  "step3": "Gradually add the dry flour mixture to the wet cocoa‑butter blend, alternating with 1 cup whole milk. Begin and end with the flour, stirring gently after each addition to avoid over‑mixing. The batter should be thick yet pourable, with a deep chocolate sheen.",
  "step4": "Divide the batter evenly between the prepared pans, smoothing the tops with a spatula. Tap the pans lightly on the counter to release any air bubbles. Place them in the preheated oven and bake for 30‑35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center emerges clean.",
  "step5": "Allow the cakes to cool in the pans for 10 minutes, then turn them onto a wire rack to cool completely. While cooling, prepare a frosting by beating 1 cup softened butter, 3 cups powdered sugar, ½ cup cocoa powder, 2 tablespoons heavy cream, and a pinch of salt until fluffy.",
  "step6": "Once the layers are fully cooled, spread a generous layer of frosting on the bottom cake, place the second layer on top, and frost the top and sides evenly. Garnish with chocolate shavings or fresh berries, slice, and serve to eight delighted guests."
}
